sn22.156:1.2: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does view of self arise?”
sn22.156:1.3: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn22.156:1.4: “When form exists, because of grasping form and insisting on form, view of self arises.
sn22.156:1.8: consciousness exists, because of grasping consciousness and insisting on consciousness, view of self arises.
sn22.156:1.13: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would view of self arise?”
sn22.156:1.21: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would view of self arise?”
sn22.156:1.24: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
